snippet: Scientists said there was no proof that a salmon-killing disease had made its way to the Pacific Northwest, but a researcher in Canada disagreed.
abstract: Canadian biologist Alexandra Morton disputes scientific claims that there is no evidence that infectious salmon anemia, or ISA, which is devastating farmed salmon around worldwide, has reached the Pacific Northwest, threatening wild salmon habitats; says that definitively and without question that Wild Pacific salmon are testing positive for a European strain of virus.
lead_paragraph: Scientists said there was no proof that a salmon-killing disease had made its way to the Pacific Northwest, but a researcher in Canada disagreed.

headline.seo: Infectious Salmon Anemia Threat Divides Scientists
headline.main: Scientists Are Divided Over Threat to Pacific Northwest Salmon
headline.print_headline: Scientists Divide Over Threat to Pacific Northwest Salmon
